column8: NOTE ALL OF THESE ARE CUMULATIVE, NOT DAILY

column9: <--this provides counts per day for the past few weeks, but again no hospitalizations
<-- having to count bars; apparently Michigan's surveillance system DOES track this, just not providing details
"*We are developing a more comprehensive method for county datasharing. Updates will be posted on the St. Clair CountyHealth Department website in the near future.*"

column7: But on metrics tracked by the COVID Tracking Project — which collects coronavirus data from state health departments on positive and negative cases, deaths, hospitalizations, ICU and ventilator patients and recovered cases — Michigan is on par with just six other states for providing the least amount of information, only case counts and deaths.
